tit.cmt: OK
修正なし

sen.j: 班田収授法（はんでんしゅうじゅのほう）とは、古代日本において施行された農地（田）の支給・収容に関する法体系である。
sen.e: "Handen Shuju-no-ho" (the law of periodic reallocations of rice land) was a legal system related to provision and expropriation of agricultural land (rice land), enforced in the ancient Japan.
"Handen Shuju-no-ho" (the law of periodic reallocations of rice land) was a legal system related to provision and expropriation of agricultural land (rice land), enforced in ancient Japan.
"Handen Shuju-no-ho" (the law of periodic reallocations of rice land) was a legal system related to provision and expropriation of agricultural land (rice land), enforced in ancient Japan.

sen.j: 班田収授法による制度を班田収授制または班田制という。
sen.e: The system laid down by Handen Shuju-no-ho was called "Handen Shuju-sei" (a system of periodic reallocations of rice land) or "Handen-sei" (Ritsuryo land-allotment system).
The system laid down by Handen Shuju-no-ho was called "Handen Shuju-sei" (a system of periodic reallocations of rice land) or "Handen-sei" (Ritsuryo land-allotment system).
The system laid down by Handen Shuju-no-ho was called "Handen Shuju-sei" (a system of periodic reallocations of rice land) or "Handen-sei" (Ritsuryo land-allotment system).

sen.j: 班田収授制は、日本の律令制の根幹制度の一つであり、律令が整備された飛鳥時代後期から平安時代前期にかけて行われた。
sen.e: Handen Shuju-sei was one of the basic systems of the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan, adopted from the late Asuka period; when the Ritsuryo system was established, through the early Heian period.

Handen Shuju-sei was one of the basic systems of the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan, adopted from the late Asuka period; when the Ritsuryo system was established, through the early Heian period.

Handen Shuju-sei was one of the basic systems of the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code) in Japan, adopted from the late Asuka period; when the Ritsuryo system was established, through the early Heian period.

sen.j: 古代の戸籍制度・計帳に基づいて、政府から受田資格を得た貴族や人民へ田が班給された。
sen.e: Based on the family registration system and Keicho (the yearly tax registers) in the ancient times, rice land was allotted to nobles and people who had obtained the qualifications for receiving rice land from the government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Based on the family registration system and Keicho (the yearly tax registers) in the ancient times, rice land was allotted to nobles and people who had obtained the qualifications for receiving rice land from the government.

Based on the family registration system and Keicho (the yearly tax registers) in the ancient times, rice land was allotted to nobles and people who had obtained the qualifications for receiving rice land from the government.

sen.j: 死亡者の田は政府へ収公された。
sen.e: Meanwhile, when people died, rice land allotted to the people was confiscated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Meanwhile, when people died, rice land allotted to the people was confiscated.
Meanwhile, when people died, rice land allotted to the people was confiscated by the government.
sen.cmt: 政府 を追加しました。

sen.j: こうして班給された田は課税対象であり、その収穫から租が徴収された。
sen.e: As the allotted rice land was subject to taxation, rice tax was collected from the yield of the rice land.
As the allotted rice land was subject to taxation, rice tax was collected from the yield of the rice land.
As the allotted rice land was subject to taxation, rice tax was collected from the yield of the rice land.

sen.j: この制度は、当時の中国で行われていた均田制の影響のもとに施行されたと考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that this system was enforced under the influence of the Equal-field system adopted in China in those days.
It is thought that this system was enforced under the influence of the Equal-field system adopted in China in those days.
It is thought that this system was enforced under the influence of the Equal-field system adopted in China in those days.

tit.e: Start of Handen Shuju (a regulation of land ownership)
Start of Handen Shuju (a regulation of land ownership)
tit.cmt: OK
tit.e: Start of Handen Shuju (a regulation of land ownership)
tit.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 日本書紀によれば、646年正月の大化の改新の詔において「初めて戸籍・計帳・班田収授法をつくれ」とある。
sen.e: According to Nihonshoki (chronicles of Japan), an imperial edict issued on the Taika Reforms in January, 646 mentioned, 'Make the family register and Keicho, and enact the Handen Shuju-no-ho for the first time.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: According to Nihonshoki (chronicles of Japan), an imperial edict issued on the Taika Reforms in January, 646 mentioned, 'Make the family register and Keicho, and enact the Handen Shuju-no-ho for the first time.'

According to Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), an imperial edict issued on the Taika Reforms in the New Year of 646 mentioned, 'Make the family register and Keicho, and enact the Handen Shuju-no-ho for the first time.'
sen.cmt: 旧暦でもグレゴリオ暦でも通用するように、正月→New Year としました。

sen.j: これが班田収授法の初見である。
sen.e: This was the first appearance of Handen Shuju-no-ho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: This was the first appearance of Handen Shuju-no-ho.
This was the first appearance of Handen Shuju-no-ho.

sen.j: しかし、この改新の詔に関する記述には多くの疑義が出されており、このとき班田収授法が施行されたと即断することはできない。
sen.e: However, many experts have doubts about the description concerning the imperial edict issued on the Taika Reforms, so that it is difficult to conclude hastily that Handen Shuju-no-ho came into effect at this time.

However, many experts have doubts about the description concerning the imperial edict issued on the Taika Reforms, so that it is difficult to conclude hastily that Handen Shuju-no-ho came into effect at this time.

However, many experts have doubts about the description concerning the imperial edict issued on the Taika Reforms, so that it is difficult to conclude hastily that Handen Shuju-no-ho came into effect at this time.

sen.j: 班田収授法の発足は、初めて戸籍が作成された670年、若しくは飛鳥浄御原令が制定された689年以降であろうと考えられている。
sen.e: It is believed that Handen Shuju-no-ho came into effect either in 670 when family register was first made, or after the enactment of Asukakiyomihararyo (the legal code of Japanese ancient state) in 689.

It is believed that Handen Shuju-no-ho came into effect either in 670 when the family register was first made, or after the enactment of Asukakiyomihararyo (the legal code of the Japanese ancient state) in 689.

It is believed that Handen Shuju-no-ho came into effect either in 670 when the family register was first made, or after the enactment of Asuka Kiyomihara-ryo (the legal code of the Japanese ancient state) in 689.
sen.cmt: Asuka Kiyomihara-ryo とハイフンを追加しました。

tit.e: Handen Shuju under the Ritsuryo system
Handen Shuju under the Ritsuryo system
tit.cmt: OK
tit.e: Handen Shuju under the Ritsuryo system
tit.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 班田収授法の本格的な成立は、701年の大宝律令制定による。
sen.e: Handen Shuju-no-ho came into effect on a full scale following the establishment of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) in 701.
Handen Shuju-no-ho came into effect on a full scale following the establishment of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) in 701.
Handen Shuju-no-ho came into effect on a full scale following the establishment of Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code) in 701.

sen.j: 班田収授制は、律令制の根幹をなす最重要の制度であった。
sen.e: Handen Shuju-sei was the most important system forming the basis of the Ritsuryo system.
Handen Shuju-sei was the most important system forming the basis of the Ritsuryo system.
Handen Shuju-sei was the most important system forming the basis of the Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 現存する養老律令によると、班田収授の手続きは次のとおりだったことが判っている。
sen.e: According to the existing Yoro Ritsuryo Code (code promulgated in the Yoro period), the procedure for making application for Handen Shuju is recognized as follows.
According to the existing Yoro Ritsuryo Code (code promulgated in the Yoro period), the procedure for making application for Handen Shuju is recognized as follows.
According to the existing Yoro Ritsuryo Code (code promulgated in the Yoro period), the procedure for making application for Handen Shuju is recognized as follows.

sen.j: 原則
sen.e: Principle
Principle
Principle

sen.j: まず、班田収授は6年に1度行われた。
sen.e: First of all, Handen Shuju was carried out once every six years.
First of all, Handen Shuju was carried out once every six years.
First of all, Handen Shuju was carried out once every six years.

sen.j: これを六年一班という。
sen.e: This is called Rokunen-ippan (reallocations of rice land which were carried out once every six years).
This is called Rokunen-ippan (reallocations of rice land which were carried out once every six years).
This is called Rokunen-ippan (reallocations of rice land which were carried out once every six years).

sen.j: 同様に戸籍も同様に6年に1度作成された。
sen.e: Similarly, family register was made once every six years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Similarly, the family register was made once every six years.
Similarly, the family register was made once every six years.

sen.j: 戸籍作成に併せて班田収授も実施されていた。
sen.e: Handen Shuju was carried out concurrently with the renewal of the family register.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Handen Shuju was carried out concurrently with the renewal of the family register.
Handen Shuju was carried out concurrently with the renewal of the family register.

sen.j: 戸籍において、新たに受田資格を得た者に対して田が班給されるとともに、死亡者の田は収公された。
sen.e: Based on the family register, rice land was allotted to the people who had newly obtained the qualifications for receiving rice land, while rice land was confiscated from people who had died.
Based on the family register, rice land was allotted to the people who had newly obtained the qualifications for receiving rice land, while rice land was confiscated from people who had died.
Based on the family register, rice land was allotted to the people who had newly obtained the qualifications for receiving rice land, while rice land was confiscated from people who had died.

sen.j: 手続き
sen.e: Procedure
Procedure
Procedure

sen.j: 戸籍作成の翌年から班田収授の手続きが開始する。
sen.e: The procedure for Handen Shuju started from the next year after the family register was made.
The procedure for Handen Shuju started from the next year after the family register was made.
The procedure for Handen Shuju started from the next year after the family register was made.

sen.j: 戸籍作成翌年の10月1日から11月1日までの間に、京又は国府の官司が帳簿を作成し、前回との異動状況を校勘する。
sen.e: From October 1 through November 1 (old calender) of the next year after the family register was made, the government official of the capital or kokufu (provincial office) made account books and revised the state of changes by comparing the newest account books with those of the previous.

From October 1 through November 1 (old calender) of the next year after the family register was made, the government official of the capital or kokufu (provincial office) made account books and revised the state of changes by comparing the newest account books with those of the previous.

From October 1 through November 1 (old calender) of the next year after the family register was made, the government official of the capital or kokufu (provincial office) made account books and revised the state of changes by comparing the newest account books with those of the previous.

sen.j: そして、翌1月30日までに太政官へ申請した。
sen.e: And then, people applied to the Daijokan (Grand Council of State) by next January 30 (old calender).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。申請するのが、資格を得た者なのか官司なのかわかりません。訳は資格を得た者で行いました。
sen.e: And then, people applied to the Daijokan (Grand Council of State) by next January 30 (old calender).
And then, people applied to the Daijokan (Grand Council of State) by next January 30 (old calender).

sen.j: 2月30日までに許可され、班田収授が実施された。
sen.e: They received approval by February 30 (old calender), thereby Handen Shuju was carried out.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: They received approval by February 30 (old calender), thereby Handen Shuju was carried out.
They received approval by February 30 (old calender), thereby Handen Shuju was carried out.

sen.j: 対象
sen.e: Object
Object
Object

sen.j: 律令（田令）において、口分田・位田・職分田・功田・賜田が班田収授の対象とされた。
sen.e: In the Ritsuryo System, Kubunden (rice fields given to each farmer in the Ritsuryo system), Iden (fields given according to the court rank), Shikibunden (rice fields given according to the position of government officials), Kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state) and Shiden (rice fields especially given by the emperor) were rice land subject to Handen Shuju.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In the Ritsuryo System, Kubunden (rice fields given to each farmer in the Ritsuryo system), Iden (fields given according to the court rank), Shikibunden (rice fields given according to the position of government officials), Kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state) and Shiden (rice fields especially given by the emperor) were rice land subject to Handen Shuju.

In the Ritsuryo system, Kubunden (rice fields given to each farmer in the Ritsuryo system), Iden (fields given according to the court rank), Shikibunden (rice fields given according to the position of government officials), Kuden (rice fields given to those who did meritorious deeds for the state) and Shiden (rice fields especially given by the emperor) were rice land subject to Handen Shuju.
sen.cmt: Ritsuryo system のsystem を小文字にしました。

sen.j: 例外は寺田・神田のみとされた。
sen.e: Only Jiden (rice fields owned by temples) and Shinden (rice fields owned by shrines) were excluded.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Only Jiden (rice fields owned by temples) and Shinden (rice fields owned by shrines) were excluded.
Only Jiden (rice fields owned by temples) and Shinden (rice fields owned by shrines) were excluded.

sen.j: 班給面積
sen.e: Size of the allotted land
Size of the allotted land
Size of the allotted land

sen.e: Kubunden
Kubunden
Kubunden

sen.j: 功田・賜田
sen.e: Kuden and Shiden
Kuden and Shiden
Kuden and Shiden

sen.j: 功田・賜田は支給面積の基準はなかった。
sen.e: There was no standard for the size of the allotted land in Kuden and Shiden.
There was no standard for the size of the allotted land in Kuden and Shiden.
There was no standard for the size of the allotted land in Kuden and Shiden.

tit.cmt: OK
修正なし

sen.j: 班田収授は、奈良時代最末期になると、浮浪・逃亡する百姓の増加や、そうした百姓を荘園が受け入れたことを背景として、次第に弛緩し始めた。
sen.e: Handen Shuju was gradually relaxed in the late Nara period due to an increasing number of peasant wandering around or escaping, and the existence of shoen (manor) accepted those peasant.
Handen Shuju was gradually relaxed in the late Nara period due to an increasing number of peasant wandering around or escaping, and the existence of shoen (manor) accepted those peasants.

Handen Shuju was gradually relaxed in the late Nara period due to an increasing number of peasant wandering around or escaping, and the existence of shoen (manor in medieval Japan) accepted those peasants.
sen.cmt: 荘園 補足に追加しました。

sen.j: そのため、桓武天皇は6年1班を12年1班に改め、班田収授の維持を図った。
sen.e: Therefore, the Emperor Kammu strove to maintain the Handen Shuju by adopting a system of Juninen-ippan (reallocations of rice land which were carried out once every 12 year) instead of Rokunen-ippan.
Therefore, the Emperor Kammu strove to maintain the Handen Shuju by adopting a system of Juninen-ippan (reallocations of rice land which were carried out once every 12 year) instead of Rokunen-ippan.
Therefore, the Emperor Kanmu strove to maintain the Handen Shuju by adopting a system of Juninen-ippan (reallocations of rice land which were carried out once every 12 year) instead of Rokunen-ippan.
sen.cmt: Kanmu とスペルを変更しました。

sen.j: しかし、田地の不足、班田手続きの煩雑さ、偽籍の増加等により、平安時代初期には班田収授が実施されなくなった。
sen.e: However, due to the deficiency of rice field, the complexity of the procedure for Handen Shuju, the increase of false registers and so on, Handen Shuju became abandoned in the early Heian period.
However, due to the deficiency of rice fields, the complexity of the procedure for Handen Shuju, the increase of false registers and so on, Handen Shuju was abandoned in the early Heian period.
However, due to the deficiency of rice fields, the complexity of the procedure for Handen Shuju, the increase of false registers and so on, Handen Shuju was abandoned in the early Heian period.

sen.j: 902年（延喜2年）、醍醐天皇により班田が行われたが、実質的にこれが最後の班田となった。
sen.e: Handen Shuju carried out in 902 under the instruction of the Emperor Daigo was the last Handen Shuju in effect.
Handen Shuju carried out in 902 under the instruction of the Emperor Daigo was the last Handen Shuju in effect.
Handen Shuju carried out in 902 under the instruction of the Emperor Daigo was the last Handen Shuju in effect.

sen.j: 班田収授は唐の均田制を参考にしたものである。
sen.e: Following the Equal-field system in the Tang Dynasty, the Japanese government introduced Handen Shuju.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Following the Equal-field system in the Tang Dynasty, the Japanese government introduced Handen Shuju.
Following the Equal-field system in the Tang Dynasty, the Japanese government introduced Handen Shuju.

sen.j: その手本となった唐が780年に両税法を施行し既に均田制が崩壊している。
sen.e: However, the model country, Tang Dynasty introduced Ryozeiho (taxation law in enforcement in China until Ming Dynasty) in 780 instead of the Equal-field system that had already collapsed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, the model country, Tang Dynasty introduced Ryozeiho (taxation law in enforcement in China until the Ming Dynasty) in 780 instead of the Equal-field system that had already collapsed.
However, the model country, Tang Dynasty introduced Ryozei-ho (taxation law in enforcement in China until the Ming Dynasty) in 780 instead of the Equal-field system that had already collapsed.

sen.j: よって、このような制度を当時の日本が導入する事自体に無理があったと言える。
sen.e: Therefore, it must have been difficult for Japan at that time to introduce such a system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, it must have been difficult for Japan at that time to introduce such a system.
Therefore, it must have been difficult for Japan at that time to introduce such a system.
